trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting Configuration of Driver Deployment, Testing and Debugging
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting Configuration of Driver Deployment, Testing and Debugging

trans-unit.source: Provisioning a target computer is described in [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 8.1)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909).
trans-unit.target: Provisioning a target computer is described in [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 8.1)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909).

trans-unit.source: Here we give some troubleshooting tips for the provisioning process.
trans-unit.target: Here we give some troubleshooting tips for the provisioning process.

trans-unit.source: General tips
trans-unit.target: General tips

trans-unit.source: Configure Computers menu command is inactive
trans-unit.target: Configure Computers menu command is inactive

trans-unit.source: Provisioning fails
trans-unit.target: Provisioning fails

trans-unit.source: Provisioning fails
trans-unit.target: Provisioning fails

trans-unit.source: The network path was not found
trans-unit.target: The network path was not found

trans-unit.source: The network name cannot be found
trans-unit.target: The network name cannot be found

trans-unit.source: Could not access remote machine
trans-unit.target: Could not access remote machine

trans-unit.source: Debugger won't connect or break in
trans-unit.target: Debugger won't connect or break in

trans-unit.source: Debugger network connection
trans-unit.target: Debugger network connection

trans-unit.source: Debugger 1394 connection
trans-unit.target: Debugger 1394 connection

trans-unit.source: Debugger serial connection
trans-unit.target: Debugger serial connection

trans-unit.source: Configure Computers menu command is inactive
trans-unit.target: Configure Computers menu command is inactive

trans-unit.source: When you first start Microsoft Visual Studio, the **Test > Configure Computers** command on the **Driver** menu might be inactive (greyed out).
trans-unit.target: When you first start Microsoft Visual Studio, the **Test > Configure Computers** command on the **Driver** menu might be inactive (greyed out).

trans-unit.source: If you wait about 20 seconds, and then click the **Driver** menu again, the **Test > Configure Computers** command will be available.
trans-unit.target: If you wait about 20 seconds, and then click the **Driver** menu again, the **Test > Configure Computers** command will be available.

trans-unit.source: Provisioning fails: General tips
trans-unit.target: Provisioning fails: General tips

trans-unit.source: If provisioning fails, read the sequence of messages in the Computer Configuration window.
trans-unit.target: If provisioning fails, read the sequence of messages in the Computer Configuration window.

trans-unit.source: Typically, this window also displays the location of the configuration log.
trans-unit.target: Typically, this window also displays the location of the configuration log.

trans-unit.source: View the log and make a note of its location so you can refer to it later.
trans-unit.target: View the log and make a note of its location so you can refer to it later.

trans-unit.source: The path to the log might contain a hidden folder.
trans-unit.target: The path to the log might contain a hidden folder.

trans-unit.source: For example, in the following path, AppData is a hidden folder.
trans-unit.target: For example, in the following path, AppData is a hidden folder.

trans-unit.source: C:\\Users\\*currentUser*\\AppData\\Roaming\\Microsoft\\DriverTest\\Install
trans-unit.target: C:\\Users\\*currentUser*\\AppData\\Roaming\\Microsoft\\DriverTest\\Install

trans-unit.source: The log file will have a name similar to this:
trans-unit.target: The log file will have a name similar to this:

trans-unit.source: Driver Test Computer Configuration 20121115130459167.log
trans-unit.target: Driver Test Computer Configuration 20121115130459167.log

trans-unit.source: Provisioning fails: The network path was not found
trans-unit.target: Provisioning fails: The network path was not found

trans-unit.source: When you start to provision a target computer, you might see a message that says **The network path was not found**.
trans-unit.target: When you start to provision a target computer, you might see a message that says **The network path was not found**.

trans-unit.source: On the target computer, make sure that you have turned on **Network Discovery** and that you have turned on **File and Printer Sharing** for the appropriate network profile.
trans-unit.target: On the target computer, make sure that you have turned on **Network Discovery** and that you have turned on **File and Printer Sharing** for the appropriate network profile.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the host and target computers are joined to a network domain, you must turn on network discovery and file and printer sharing for the **Domain** network profile.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the host and target computers are joined to a network domain, you must turn on network discovery and file and printer sharing for the **Domain** network profile.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 8.1)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 8.1)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909).

trans-unit.source: Make sure you can ping the target computer from the host computer.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you can ping the target computer from the host computer.

trans-unit.source: On the host computer, open a Command Prompt window, and enter **ping** *targetComputerName*, where *targetComputerName* is the name of the target computer.
trans-unit.target: On the host computer, open a Command Prompt window, and enter **ping** *targetComputerName*, where *targetComputerName* is the name of the target computer.

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: You might see several messages before you see the message **The network path was not found**.
trans-unit.target: You might see several messages before you see the message **The network path was not found**.

trans-unit.source: Some of those messages might make you think that the network path was found and the first steps of provisioning were succeeding.
trans-unit.target: Some of those messages might make you think that the network path was found and the first steps of provisioning were succeeding.

trans-unit.source: In fact, the network path was not found and no portion of provisioning succeeded.
trans-unit.target: In fact, the network path was not found and no portion of provisioning succeeded.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might see this:
trans-unit.target: For example, you might see this:

trans-unit.source: Provisioning fails: The network name cannot be found
trans-unit.target: Provisioning fails: The network name cannot be found

trans-unit.source: When you start to provision a target computer, you might see a message that says **The network name cannot be found**.
trans-unit.target: When you start to provision a target computer, you might see a message that says **The network name cannot be found**.

trans-unit.source: Double check the name of the target computer.
trans-unit.target: Double check the name of the target computer.

trans-unit.source: If the computer name you entered originally was incorrect, start the provisioning wizard again (**Driver > Test > Configure Computers)**.
trans-unit.target: If the computer name you entered originally was incorrect, start the provisioning wizard again (**Driver > Test > Configure Computers)**.

trans-unit.source: Select the incorrect computer name, and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select the incorrect computer name, and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: For **Computer name**, enter the correct name of the target computer, and complete the wizard.
trans-unit.target: For **Computer name**, enter the correct name of the target computer, and complete the wizard.

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: You might see several messages before you see the message **The network name cannot be found**.
trans-unit.target: You might see several messages before you see the message **The network name cannot be found**.

trans-unit.source: Some of those messages might make you think that the computer name was found and the first steps of provisioning were succeeding.
trans-unit.target: Some of those messages might make you think that the computer name was found and the first steps of provisioning were succeeding.

trans-unit.source: In fact, the computer name was not found, and no portion of provisioning succeeded.
trans-unit.target: In fact, the computer name was not found, and no portion of provisioning succeeded.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might see this:
trans-unit.target: For example, you might see this:

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: The messages that are displayed when you enter an incorrect target computer name can vary.
trans-unit.target: The messages that are displayed when you enter an incorrect target computer name can vary.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might see a message about enabling network discovery.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might see a message about enabling network discovery.

trans-unit.source: Or you might be prompted to enter credentials.
trans-unit.target: Or you might be prompted to enter credentials.

trans-unit.source: Provisioning fails: Could not access remote machine
trans-unit.target: Provisioning fails: Could not access remote machine

trans-unit.source: When you start to provision a target computer, you might see a message that says **Could not access the remote machine** "*computerName*" **over the network**.
trans-unit.target: When you start to provision a target computer, you might see a message that says **Could not access the remote machine** "*computerName*" **over the network**.

trans-unit.source: This message can be displayed for several reasons.
trans-unit.target: This message can be displayed for several reasons.

trans-unit.source: Verify that your host and target computers are both joined to the same domain or the same workgroup.
trans-unit.target: Verify that your host and target computers are both joined to the same domain or the same workgroup.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 8.1)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 8.1)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909).

trans-unit.source: Verify that you entered the correct name for the target computer.
trans-unit.target: Verify that you entered the correct name for the target computer.

trans-unit.source: Verify that you have enabled network discovery and file and print sharing on the target computer.
trans-unit.target: Verify that you have enabled network discovery and file and print sharing on the target computer.

trans-unit.source: Debugger breakpoints are not triggered for kernel-mode driver
trans-unit.target: Debugger breakpoints are not triggered for kernel-mode driver

trans-unit.source: Deploy the driver with breakpoints disabled.
trans-unit.target: Deploy the driver with breakpoints disabled.

trans-unit.source: Manually break into the kernel-mode debugger.
trans-unit.target: Manually break into the kernel-mode debugger.

trans-unit.source: Set an exception on load of the module:
trans-unit.target: Set an exception on load of the module:

trans-unit.source: Enable the breakpoint and resume execution.
trans-unit.target: Enable the breakpoint and resume execution.

trans-unit.source: On the target computer, disable the device node and then re-enable it.
trans-unit.target: On the target computer, disable the device node and then re-enable it.

trans-unit.source: Debugger won't connect or break in: Network connection
trans-unit.target: Debugger won't connect or break in: Network connection

trans-unit.source: Verify that your debugging application is allowed through the firewall for all network types.
trans-unit.target: Verify that your debugging application is allowed through the firewall for all network types.

trans-unit.source: Check with network administrator about ports that allow network debugging.
trans-unit.target: Check with network administrator about ports that allow network debugging.

trans-unit.source: If the target computer has more than one network adapter, you must specify the bus parameters of the network adapter that you intend to use for debugging.
trans-unit.target: If the target computer has more than one network adapter, you must specify the bus parameters of the network adapter that you intend to use for debugging.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Troubleshooting Tips for Debugging over a Network Cable](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/hardware/hh439346)
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Troubleshooting Tips for Debugging over a Network Cable](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/hardware/hh439346)

trans-unit.source: Debugger won't connect or break in: 1394 connection
trans-unit.target: Debugger won't connect or break in: 1394 connection

trans-unit.source: If the target computer has more than one 1394 controller, you must specify the bus parameters of the 1394 controller that you intend to use for debugging.
trans-unit.target: If the target computer has more than one 1394 controller, you must specify the bus parameters of the 1394 controller that you intend to use for debugging.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Troubleshooting Tips for Debugging over a 1394 Cable](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/hardware/ff556866).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Troubleshooting Tips for Debugging over a 1394 Cable](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/hardware/ff556866).

trans-unit.source: Debugger won't connect or break in : Serial connection
trans-unit.target: Debugger won't connect or break in : Serial connection

trans-unit.source: Check the COM port numbers on the host and target computer.
trans-unit.target: Check the COM port numbers on the host and target computer.

trans-unit.source: Verify that you have configured the same baud rate for debugging on both the host and target computers.
trans-unit.target: Verify that you have configured the same baud rate for debugging on both the host and target computers.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Troubleshooting Tips for Debugging over a Serial Cable](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/hardware/hh439359)
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Troubleshooting Tips for Debugging over a Serial Cable](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/hardware/hh439359)
